solution_line_template: First find the total time James spends painting space marines: {time_per_space_marine} minutes/marine * {num_space_marines} marines = <<{time_per_space_marine}*{num_space_marines}={total_time_space_marines}>>{total_time_space_marines} minutes
Then find the total time James spends painting dreadnoughts: {time_per_dreadnought} minutes/dreadnought * {num_dreadnoughts} dreadnoughts = {total_time_dreadnoughts} minutes

Then add the two amounts of time to find the total time James spends painting: {total_time_space_marines} minutes + {total_time_dreadnoughts} minutes = <<{total_time_space_marines}+{total_time_dreadnoughts}={total_painting_time}>>{total_painting_time} minutes
